intro: Zeugandra iranica, commonly known as the Iranian zeugandra, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are often borne on the stems. Zeugandra iranica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features. Its botanical significance lies in its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
